name: p105 - Guardian
notes:
"Why the generated weapon doesn't match the example in the Field Catalogue

- The manifest in the book has a base capacity of 30 rounds but I think it should be 18, a base of 50 for light support weapon (p31) minus 40% for heavy rifle calibre (p39) then minus 40% for rocket propelled.
This could be an ambiguity in the rules, is the 40% ammo capacity reduction for rocket propelled ammo instead of or as well as any reduction the non-rocket propelled ammo would have. I think it make sense for it to be as well as, otherwise the capacity reduction for rocket propelled anti-material ammo would be lower than that of the non-rocket propelled version.
- The manifest in the book doesn't have the 50% receiver & barrel weight reduction for rocket propelled (p38)
- The manifest in the book has a cost of Cr200 and weight of 0.1kg for the scope accessory but the rules say Cr50 and 0.2kg (p46). It's possible this was meant to be a laser pointer as the values would be correct for that
- The manifest in the book doesn't have the Quickdraw -2 or Scope trait for the scope accessory (p46)
- The table in the book has a range of 275m for ball ammo but I think this is just a typo and should be 250m as is the case for explosive and HEAP ammo.
- The table in the book doesn't take into account the Physical Signature +1 modifier for explosive ammo (p50)
- The table in the book has an AP 4 for HEAP ammo but I think it should be 5. HEAP ammo would give the weapon a Penetration of 2 which the rules (p18) say results in AP 1 plus 1 per full dice of damage, -1 damage per 2 full dice of damage (p18). With a damage of 4D this would result in AP 5 and a Damage -2 modifier
"
